name.description: The name of the evaluation.

data_source_config.description: The configuration for the data source used for the evaluation runs.

testing_criteria.description: A list of graders for all eval runs in this group.

CreateEvalResponsesRunDataSource.title: ResponsesRunDataSource
CreateEvalResponsesRunDataSource.description: A ResponsesRunDataSource object describing a model sampling configuration.

type.description: The type of run data source. Always `completions`.
The type of input messages. Always `template`.

template.description:
A list of chat messages forming the prompt or context. May include
variable references to the "item" namespace, ie
{{item.name}}.

role.description: The role of the message (e.g. "system", "assistant", "user").

content.description: The content of the message.

type.description: The type of input messages. Always `item_reference`.

item_reference.description: A reference to a variable in the "item" namespace. Ie, "item.name"

temperature.description: A higher temperature increases randomness in the outputs.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens in the generated output.

top_p.description:
An alternative to temperature for nucleus sampling; 1.0 includes
all tokens.

seed.description: A seed value to initialize the randomness, during sampling.

model.description:
The name of the model to use for generating completions (e.g.
"o3-mini").

x-oaiMeta.name: The completions data source object used to configure an individual run

name.description: The name of the run.

data_source.description: Details about the run's data source.

file.description: The File object (not file name) to be uploaded.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the uploaded file. One of: - `assistants`: Used in the Assistants API - `batch`: Used in the Batch API - `fine-tune`: Used for fine-tuning - `vision`: Images used for vision fine-tuning - `user_data`: Flexible file type for any purpose - `evals`: Used for eval data sets

project_ids.description: The project identifiers to grant access to.

model.description:
The name of the model to fine-tune. You can select one of the
[supported models](/docs/guides/fine-tuning#which-models-can-be-fine-tuned).

training_file.description:
The ID of an uploaded file that contains training data.

See [upload file](/docs/api-reference/files/create) for how to upload a file.

Your dataset must be formatted as a JSONL file. Additionally, you must upload your file with the purpose `fine-tune`.

The contents of the file should differ depending on if the model uses the [chat](/docs/api-reference/fine-tuning/chat-input), [completions](/docs/api-reference/fine-tuning/completions-input) format, or if the fine-tuning method uses the [preference](/docs/api-reference/fine-tuning/preference-input) format.

See the [fine-tuning guide](/docs/guides/fine-tuning) for more details.

hyperparameters.description:
The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job.
This value is now deprecated in favor of `method`, and should be passed in under the `method` parameter.

batch_size.description:
Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters
are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description:
Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid
overfitting.

n_epochs.description:
The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle
through the training dataset.

suffix.description:
A string of up to 64 characters that will be added to your fine-tuned model name.

For example, a `suffix` of "custom-model-name" would produce a model name like `ft:gpt-4o-mini:openai:custom-model-name:7p4lURel`.

validation_file.description:
The ID of an uploaded file that contains validation data.

If you provide this file, the data is used to generate validation
metrics periodically during fine-tuning. These metrics can be viewed in
the fine-tuning results file.
The same data should not be present in both train and validation files.

Your dataset must be formatted as a JSONL file. You must upload your file with the purpose `fine-tune`.

See the [fine-tuning guide](/docs/guides/fine-tuning) for more details.

integrations.description: A list of integrations to enable for your fine-tuning job.

type.description: The type of integration to enable. Currently, only "wandb" (Weights and Biases) is supported.

wandb.description:
The settings for your integration with Weights and Biases. This payload specifies the project that
metrics will be sent to. Optionally, you can set an explicit display name for your run, add tags
to your run, and set a default entity (team, username, etc) to be associated with your run.

project.description: The name of the project that the new run will be created under.

name.description: A display name to set for the run. If not set, we will use the Job ID as the name.

entity.description:
The entity to use for the run. This allows you to set the team or username of the WandB user that you would
like associated with the run. If not set, the default entity for the registered WandB API key is used.

tags.description:
A list of tags to be attached to the newly created run. These tags are passed through directly to WandB. Some
default tags are generated by OpenAI: "openai/finetune", "openai/{base-model}", "openai/{ftjob-abcdef}".

seed.description:
The seed controls the reproducibility of the job. Passing in the same seed and job parameters should produce the same results, but may differ in rare cases.
If a seed is not specified, one will be generated for you.

image.description:
The image(s) to edit. Must be a supported image file or an array of images.

For `gpt-image-1`, each image should be a `png`, `webp`, or `jpg` file less
than 25MB. You can provide up to 16 images.

For `dall-e-2`, you can only provide one image, and it should be a square
`png` file less than 4MB.

prompt.description:
A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is
1000 characters for `dall-e-2`, and 32000 characters for
`gpt-image-1`.
prompt.example: A cute baby sea otter wearing a beret

mask.description:
An additional image whose fully transparent areas (e.g. where alpha
is zero) indicate where `image` should be edited. If there are
multiple images provided, the mask will be applied on the first
image. Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and have the same
dimensions as `image`.

model.description:
The model to use for image generation. Only `dall-e-2` and
`gpt-image-1` are supported. Defaults to `dall-e-2` unless a
parameter specific to `gpt-image-1` is used.

n.description: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10.

size.description:
The size of the generated images. Must be one of `1024x1024`,
`1536x1024` (landscape), `1024x1536` (portrait), or `auto` (default
value) for `gpt-image-1`, and one of `256x256`, `512x512`, or
`1024x1024` for `dall-e-2`.

response_format.description:
The format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one
of `url` or `b64_json`. URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after the
image has been generated. This parameter is only supported for
`dall-e-2`, as `gpt-image-1` will always return base64-encoded
images.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. [Learn more](/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#end-user-ids).

quality.description: The quality of the image that will be generated. `high`, `medium` and `low` are only supported for `gpt-image-1`. `dall-e-2` only supports `standard` quality. Defaults to `auto`.

prompt.description:
A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is
32000 characters for `gpt-image-1`, 1000 characters for `dall-e-2`
and 4000 characters for `dall-e-3`.

model.description:
The model to use for image generation. One of `dall-e-2`,
`dall-e-3`, or `gpt-image-1`. Defaults to `dall-e-2` unless a
parameter specific to `gpt-image-1` is used.

n.description:
The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10. For
`dall-e-3`, only `n=1` is supported.

quality.description:
The quality of the image that will be generated.

- `auto` (default value) will automatically select the best quality for the given model.
- `high`, `medium` and `low` are supported for `gpt-image-1`.
- `hd` and `standard` are supported for `dall-e-3`.
- `standard` is the only option for `dall-e-2`.

response_format.description:
The format in which generated images with `dall-e-2` and `dall-e-3`
are returned. Must be one of `url` or `b64_json`. URLs are only
valid for 60 minutes after the image has been generated. This
parameter isn't supported for `gpt-image-1` which will always return
base64-encoded images.

output_format.description:
The format in which the generated images are returned. This
parameter is only supported for `gpt-image-1`. Must be one of `png`,
`jpeg`, or `webp`.

output_compression.description:
The compression level (0-100%) for the generated images. This
parameter is only supported for `gpt-image-1` with the `webp` or
`jpeg` output formats, and defaults to 100.

size.description:
The size of the generated images. Must be one of `1024x1024`,
`1536x1024` (landscape), `1024x1536` (portrait), or `auto` (default
value) for `gpt-image-1`, one of `256x256`, `512x512`, or
`1024x1024` for `dall-e-2`, and one of `1024x1024`, `1792x1024`, or
`1024x1792` for `dall-e-3`.

moderation.description:
Control the content-moderation level for images generated by
`gpt-image-1`. Must be either `low` for less restrictive filtering
or `auto` (default value).

background.description:
Allows to set transparency for the background of the generated image(s).
This parameter is only supported for `gpt-image-1`. Must be one of
`transparent`, `opaque` or `auto` (default value). When `auto` is used, the
model will automatically determine the best background for the image.

If `transparent`, the output format needs to support transparency, so it
should be set to either `png` (default value) or `webp`.

style.description:
The style of the generated images. This parameter is only supported
for `dall-e-3`. Must be one of `vivid` or `natural`. Vivid causes
the model to lean towards generating hyper-real and dramatic images.
Natural causes the model to produce more natural, less hyper-real
looking images.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. [Learn more](/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#end-user-ids).

image.description:
The image to use as the basis for the variation(s). Must be a valid
PNG file, less than 4MB, and square.

model.description:
The model to use for image generation. Only `dall-e-2` is supported
at this time.

n.description: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10.

response_format.description:
The format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one
of `url` or `b64_json`. URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after the
image has been generated.

size.description:
The size of the generated images. Must be one of `256x256`,
`512x512`, or `1024x1024`.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. [Learn more](/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#end-user-ids).

role.description:
The role of the entity that is creating the message. Allowed values include:
- `user`: Indicates the message is sent by an actual user and should be used in most cases to represent user-generated messages.
- `assistant`: Indicates the message is generated by the assistant. Use this value to insert messages from the assistant into the conversation.

oneOf.description: The text contents of the message.
oneOf.title: Text content

oneOf.description:
An array of content parts with a defined type, each can be of type
`text` or images can be passed with `image_url` or `image_file`.
Image types are only supported on [Vision-compatible
models](/docs/models).
oneOf.title: Array of content parts

file_id.description: The ID of the file to attach to the message.

tools.description: The tools to add this file to.

attachments.description:
A list of files attached to the message, and the tools they should
be added to.

input.description:
Input (or inputs) to classify. Can be a single string, an array of strings, or
an array of multi-modal input objects similar to other models.

oneOf.description: A string of text to classify for moderation.
An array of strings to classify for moderation.
An array of multi-modal inputs to the moderation model.
An object describing an image to classify.

type.description: Always `image_url`.

image_url.description:
Contains either an image URL or a data URL for a base64 encoded
image.

url.description: Either a URL of the image or the base64 encoded image data.

oneOf.description: An object describing text to classify.

type.description: Always `text`.

text.description: A string of text to classify.

model.description:
The content moderation model you would like to use. Learn more in
[the moderation guide](/docs/guides/moderation), and learn about
available models [here](/docs/models#moderation).

CreateModerationResponse.description: Represents if a given text input is potentially harmful.

id.description: The unique identifier for the moderation request.

model.description: The model used to generate the moderation results.

flagged.description: Whether any of the below categories are flagged.

categories.description: A list of the categories, and whether they are flagged or not.

hate.description:
Content that expresses, incites, or promotes hate based on race,
gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual
orientation, disability status, or caste. Hateful content
aimed at non-protected groups (e.g., chess players) is
harassment.

hate/threatening.description:
Hateful content that also includes violence or serious harm towards
the targeted group based on race, gender, ethnicity,
religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability
status, or caste.

harassment.description:
Content that expresses, incites, or promotes harassing language
towards any target.

harassment/threatening.description:
Harassment content that also includes violence or serious harm
towards any target.

illicit.description:
Content that includes instructions or advice that facilitate the
planning or execution of wrongdoing, or that gives advice
or instruction on how to commit illicit acts. For example,
"how to shoplift" would fit this category.

illicit/violent.description:
Content that includes instructions or advice that facilitate the
planning or execution of wrongdoing that also includes
violence, or that gives advice or instruction on the
procurement of any weapon.

self-harm.description:
Content that promotes, encourages, or depicts acts of self-harm,
such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.

self-harm/intent.description:
Content where the speaker expresses that they are engaging or
intend to engage in acts of self-harm, such as suicide,
cutting, and eating disorders.

self-harm/instructions.description:
Content that encourages performing acts of self-harm, such as
suicide, cutting, and eating disorders, or that gives
instructions or advice on how to commit such acts.

sexual.description:
Content meant to arouse sexual excitement, such as the description
of sexual activity, or that promotes sexual services
(excluding sex education and wellness).

sexual/minors.description:
Sexual content that includes an individual who is under 18 years
old.

violence.description: Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury.

violence/graphic.description:
Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury in graphic
detail.

category_scores.description:
A list of the categories along with their scores as predicted by
model.

category_applied_input_types.description:
A list of the categories along with the input type(s) that the
score applies to.

hate.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'hate'.

hate/threatening.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'hate/threatening'.

harassment.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'harassment'.

harassment/threatening.description:
The applied input type(s) for the category
'harassment/threatening'.

illicit.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'illicit'.

illicit/violent.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'illicit/violent'.

self-harm.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'self-harm'.

self-harm/intent.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'self-harm/intent'.

self-harm/instructions.description:
The applied input type(s) for the category
'self-harm/instructions'.

sexual.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'sexual'.

sexual/minors.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'sexual/minors'.

violence.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'violence'.

violence/graphic.description: The applied input type(s) for the category 'violence/graphic'.

input.description:
Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response.

Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](/docs/guides/text)
- [Image inputs](/docs/guides/images)
- [File inputs](/docs/guides/pdf-files)
- [Conversation state](/docs/guides/conversation-state)
- [Function calling](/docs/guides/function-calling)

oneOf.title: Text input
oneOf.description:
A text input to the model, equivalent to a text input with the
`user` role.

oneOf.title: Input item list
oneOf.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing 
different content types.

include.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently
supported values are:
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of  the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

store.description:
Whether to store the generated model response for later retrieval via
API.

stream.description:
If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client
as it is generated using [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format).
See the [Streaming section below](/docs/api-reference/responses-streaming)
for more information.

assistant_id.description:
The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) to use to
execute this run.

model.description:
The ID of the [Model](/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to
execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the
model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated
with the assistant will be used.

instructions.description:
Overrides the
[instructions](/docs/api-reference/assistants/createAssistant) of
the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a
per-run basis.

additional_instructions.description:
Appends additional instructions at the end of the instructions for
the run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run
basis without overriding other instructions.

additional_messages.description: Adds additional messages to the thread before creating the run.

tools.description:
Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is
useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

stream.description: If `true`, returns a stream of events that happen during the Run as server-sent events, terminating when the Run enters a terminal state with a `data: [DONE]` message.

max_prompt_tokens.description: The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

model.description: One of the available [TTS models](/docs/models#tts): `tts-1`, `tts-1-hd` or `gpt-4o-mini-tts`.

input.description:
The text to generate audio for. The maximum length is 4096
characters.

instructions.description:
Control the voice of your generated audio with additional
instructions. Does not work with `tts-1` or `tts-1-hd`.

voice.description:
The voice to use when generating the audio. Supported voices are
`alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo`, `fable`, `onyx`, `nova`,
`sage`, `shimmer`, and `verse`. Previews of the voices are available
in the [Text to speech
guide](/docs/guides/text-to-speech#voice-options).

response_format.description:
The format to audio in. Supported formats are `mp3`, `opus`, `aac`,
`flac`, `wav`, and `pcm`.

speed.description:
The speed of the generated audio. Select a value from `0.25` to
`4.0`. `1.0` is the default.

assistant_id.description:
The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) to use to
execute this run.

model.description:
The ID of the [Model](/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to
execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the
model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated
with the assistant will be used.

instructions.description:
Override the default system message of the assistant. This is
useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tools.description:
Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is
useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs made available to the `code_interpreter` tool. There can be a maximum of 20 files associated with the tool.

vector_store_ids.description: The ID of the [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this assistant. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the assistant.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

stream.description: If `true`, returns a stream of events that happen during the Run as server-sent events, terminating when the Run enters a terminal state with a `data: [DONE]` message.

max_prompt_tokens.description: The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

CreateThreadRequest.description:
Options to create a new thread. If no thread is provided when running a 
request, an empty thread will be created.

messages.description:
A list of [messages](/docs/api-reference/messages) to start the
thread with.

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are made available to the assistant's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs made available to the `code_interpreter` tool. There can be a maximum of 20 files associated with the tool.

vector_store_ids.description: The [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

vector_stores.description: A helper to create a [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) with file_ids and attach it to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs to add to the vector store. There can be a maximum of 10000 files in a vector store.

chunking_strategy.description:
The chunking strategy used to chunk the file(s). If not set, will
use the `auto` strategy.

oneOf.title: Auto Chunking Strategy
oneOf.description:
The default strategy. This strategy currently uses a
`max_chunk_size_tokens` of `800` and
`chunk_overlap_tokens` of `400`.

type.description: Always `auto`.
Always `static`.

max_chunk_size_tokens.description:
The maximum number of tokens in each chunk. The default value is
`800`. The minimum value is `100` and the
maximum value is `4096`.

chunk_overlap_tokens.description:
The number of tokens that overlap between chunks. The default value is `400`.

Note that the overlap must not exceed half of `max_chunk_size_tokens`.

file.description: The audio file object (not file name) to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.

model.description: ID of the model to use. The options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1` (which is powered by our open source Whisper V2 model).

language.description: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in [ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format will improve accuracy and latency.

prompt.description: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The [prompt](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting) should match the audio language.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use [log probability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Log_probability) to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

include[].description:
Additional information to include in the transcription response.
`logprobs` will return the log probabilities of the tokens in the
response to understand the model's confidence in the transcription.
`logprobs` only works with response_format set to `json` and only with
the models `gpt-4o-transcribe` and `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`.

timestamp_granularities[].description: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription. `response_format` must be set `verbose_json` to use timestamp granularities. Either or both of these options are supported: `word`, or `segment`. Note: There is no additional latency for segment timestamps, but generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.

stream.description:
If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client
as it is generated using [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format). 
See the [Streaming section of the Speech-to-Text guide](/docs/guides/speech-to-text?lang=curl#streaming-transcriptions)
for more information.

Note: Streaming is not supported for the `whisper-1` model and will be ignored.

CreateTranscriptionResponseJson.description:
Represents a transcription response returned by model, based on the
provided input.

text.description: The transcribed text.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of the tokens in the transcription. Only returned with the models `gpt-4o-transcribe` and `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe` if `logprobs` is added to the `include` array.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

x-oaiMeta.name: The transcription object (JSON)
x-oaiMeta.example:
{  "text": "Imagine the wildest idea that you've ever had, and you're curious about how it might scale to something that's a 100, a 1,000 times bigger. This is a place where you can get to do that."
}

CreateTranscriptionResponseVerboseJson.description:
Represents a verbose json transcription response returned by model,
based on the provided input.

language.description: The language of the input audio.

duration.description: The duration of the input audio.

text.description: The transcribed text.

words.description: Extracted words and their corresponding timestamps.

segments.description: Segments of the transcribed text and their corresponding details.

      "id": 0,
      "seek": 0,

      "end": 3.319999933242798,

      "tokens": [
        50364, 440, 7534, 390, 257, 3743, 4008, 322, 257, 2368, 4266, 786, 13, 50530
      ],
      "temperature": 0.0,
      "avg_logprob": -0.2860786020755768,
      "compression_ratio": 1.2363636493682861,
      "no_speech_prob": 0.00985979475080967
    },
    ...
  ]
}

file.description: The audio file object (not file name) translate, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.

model.description: ID of the model to use. Only `whisper-1` (which is powered by our open source Whisper V2 model) is currently available.

prompt.description: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The [prompt](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting) should be in English.

response_format.description: The format of the output, in one of these options: `json`, `text`, `srt`, `verbose_json`, or `vtt`.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use [log probability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Log_probability) to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

language.description: The language of the output translation (always `english`).

duration.description: The duration of the input audio.

text.description: The translated text.

segments.description: Segments of the translated text and their corresponding details.

filename.description: The name of the file to upload.

purpose.description:
The intended purpose of the uploaded file.

See the [documentation on File purposes](/docs/api-reference/files/create#files-create-purpose).

bytes.description: The number of bytes in the file you are uploading.

mime_type.description:
The MIME type of the file.

This must fall within the supported MIME types for your file purpose. See the supported MIME types for assistants and vision.

file_ids.description:
A list of [File](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs that the vector
store should use. Useful for tools like `file_search` that can
access files.

file_id.description:
A [File](/docs/api-reference/files) ID that the vector store should
use. Useful for tools like `file_search` that can access files.

file_ids.description:
A list of [File](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs that the vector
store should use. Useful for tools like `file_search` that can
access files.

name.description: The name of the vector store.

chunking_strategy.description:
The chunking strategy used to chunk the file(s). If not set, will
use the `auto` strategy. Only applicable if `file_ids` is non-empty.

object.description: The object type, must be `certificate.deleted`.

id.description: The ID of the certificate that was deleted.

The ID of the fine-tuned model checkpoint permission that was
deleted.

object.description: The object type, which is always "checkpoint.permission".

deleted.description:
Whether the fine-tuned model checkpoint permission was successfully
deleted.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is
always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is 
always set to `drag`.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array
of objects, eg
```
[  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

items.title: Drag path coordinates
items.description: A series of x/y coordinate pairs in the drag path.

EasyInputMessage.title: Input message
EasyInputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
`developer`.

content.description:
Text, image, or audio input to the model, used to generate a response.
Can also contain previous assistant responses.

oneOf.title: Text input
oneOf.description: A text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

Embedding.description: Represents an embedding vector returned by embedding endpoint.

index.description: The index of the embedding in the list of embeddings.

embedding.description: The embedding vector, which is a list of floats. The length of vector depends on the model as listed in the [embedding guide](/docs/guides/embeddings).

object.description: The object type, which is always "embedding".

ErrorEvent.description:
Occurs when an [error](/docs/guides/error-codes#api-errors) occurs.
This can happen due to an internal server error or a timeout.

Eval.title: Eval
Eval.description:
An Eval object with a data source config and testing criteria.
An Eval represents a task to be done for your LLM integration.
Like:
 - Improve the quality of my chatbot
 - See how well my chatbot handles customer support
 - Check if o3-mini is better at my usecase than gpt-4o

object.description: The object type.

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation.

name.description: The name of the evaluation.

data_source_config.description: Configuration of data sources used in runs of the evaluation.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the eval was created.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval object

EvalApiError.title: EvalApiError
EvalApiError.description: An object representing an error response from the Eval API.

x-oaiMeta.name: The API error object

EvalCustomDataSourceConfig.title: CustomDataSourceConfig
EvalCustomDataSourceConfig.description:
A CustomDataSourceConfig which specifies the schema of your `item` and optionally `sample` namespaces.
The response schema defines the shape of the data that will be:
- Used to define your testing criteria and
- What data is required when creating a run

type.description: The type of data source. Always `custom`.

schema.description:
The json schema for the run data source items.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval custom data source config object

EvalItem.title: Eval message object
EvalItem.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
`developer`.

content.description: Text inputs to the model - can contain template strings.

oneOf.title: Text input
oneOf.description: A text input to the model.

oneOf.title: Output text
oneOf.description: A text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output text. Always `output_text`.

text.description: The text output from the model.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.
The type of jsonl source. Always `file_content`.

content.description: The content of the jsonl file.

type.description: The type of jsonl source. Always `file_id`.

id.description: The identifier of the file.

EvalLabelModelGrader.title: LabelModelGrader
EvalLabelModelGrader.description:
A LabelModelGrader object which uses a model to assign labels to each item
in the evaluation.

type.description: The object type, which is always `label_model`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation. Must support structured outputs.

labels.description: The labels to assign to each item in the evaluation.

passing_labels.description:
The labels that indicate a passing result. Must be a subset of
labels.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval label model grader object

EvalList.title: EvalList
EvalList.description: An object representing a list of evals.

object.description: The type of this object. It is always set to "list".

data.description: An array of eval objects.

first_id.description: The identifier of the first eval in the data array.

last_id.description: The identifier of the last eval in the data array.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more evals available.

EvalPythonGrader.title: PythonGrader
EvalPythonGrader.description: A PythonGrader object that runs a python script on the input.

type.description: The object type, which is always `python`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

source.description: The source code of the python script.

image_tag.description: The image tag to use for the python script.

EvalResponsesSource.title: EvalResponsesSource
EvalResponsesSource.description: A EvalResponsesSource object describing a run data source configuration.

type.description: The type of run data source. Always `responses`.

metadata.description:
Metadata filter for the responses. This is a query parameter used
to select responses.

model.description:
The name of the model to find responses for. This is a query
parameter used to select responses.

instructions_search.description:
Optional search string for instructions. This is a query parameter
used to select responses.

created_after.description:
Only include items created after this timestamp (inclusive). This
is a query parameter used to select responses.

created_before.description:
Only include items created before this timestamp (inclusive). This
is a query parameter used to select responses.

has_tool_calls.description:
Whether the response has tool calls. This is a query parameter used
to select responses.

reasoning_effort.description:
Optional reasoning effort parameter. This is a query parameter used
to select responses.

temperature.description:
Sampling temperature. This is a query parameter used to select
responses.

top_p.description:
Nucleus sampling parameter. This is a query parameter used to
select responses.

users.description:
List of user identifiers. This is a query parameter used to select
responses.

allow_parallel_tool_calls.description:
Whether to allow parallel tool calls. This is a query parameter
used to select responses.

x-oaiMeta.name: The run data source object used to configure an individual run

EvalRun.title: EvalRun
EvalRun.description: A schema representing an evaluation run.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the associated evaluation.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

model.description: The model that is evaluated, if applicable.

name.description: The name of the evaluation run.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

report_url.description: The URL to the rendered evaluation run report on the UI dashboard.

result_counts.description: Counters summarizing the outcomes of the evaluation run.

total.description: Total number of executed output items.

errored.description: Number of output items that resulted in an error.

failed.description: Number of output items that failed to pass the evaluation.

passed.description: Number of output items that passed the evaluation.

per_model_usage.description: Usage statistics for each model during the evaluation run.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of prompt tokens used.

completion_tokens.description: The number of completion tokens generated.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.

cached_tokens.description: The number of tokens retrieved from cache.

per_testing_criteria_results.description: Results per testing criteria applied during the evaluation run.

testing_criteria.description: A description of the testing criteria.

passed.description: Number of tests passed for this criteria.

failed.description: Number of tests failed for this criteria.

data_source.description: Information about the run's data source.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run object

EvalRunList.title: EvalRunList
EvalRunList.description: An object representing a list of runs for an evaluation.

object.description: The type of this object. It is always set to "list".

data.description: An array of eval run objects.

first_id.description: The identifier of the first eval run in the data array.

last_id.description: The identifier of the last eval run in the data array.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more evals available.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run list object

EvalRunOutputItem.title: EvalRunOutputItem
EvalRunOutputItem.description: A schema representing an evaluation run output item.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run.output_item".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run output item.

run_id.description:
The identifier of the evaluation run associated with this output
item.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the evaluation group.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

datasource_item_id.description: The identifier for the data source item.

datasource_item.description: Details of the input data source item.

results.description: A list of results from the evaluation run.

sample.description: A sample containing the input and output of the evaluation run.

role.description: The role of the message sender (e.g., system, user, developer).

content.description: The content of the message.

role.description: The role of the message (e.g. "system", "assistant", "user").

content.description: The content of the message.

finish_reason.description: The reason why the sample generation was finished.

model.description: The model used for generating the sample.

usage.description: Token usage details for the sample.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.

completion_tokens.description: The number of completion tokens generated.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of prompt tokens used.

cached_tokens.description: The number of tokens retrieved from cache.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature used.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for completion.

top_p.description: The top_p value used for sampling.

seed.description: The seed used for generating the sample.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run output item object

EvalRunOutputItemList.title: EvalRunOutputItemList
EvalRunOutputItemList.description: An object representing a list of output items for an evaluation run.

object.description: The type of this object. It is always set to "list".

data.description: An array of eval run output item objects.

first_id.description: The identifier of the first eval run output item in the data array.

last_id.description: The identifier of the last eval run output item in the data array.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more eval run output items available.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run output item list object

EvalScoreModelGrader.title: ScoreModelGrader
EvalScoreModelGrader.description: A ScoreModelGrader object that uses a model to assign a score to the input.

type.description: The object type, which is always `score_model`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation.

sampling_params.description: The sampling parameters for the model.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

range.description: The range of the score. Defaults to `[0, 1]`.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval score model grader object

EvalStoredCompletionsDataSourceConfig.title: StoredCompletionsDataSourceConfig
EvalStoredCompletionsDataSourceConfig.description:
A StoredCompletionsDataSourceConfig which specifies the metadata property of your stored completions query.
This is usually metadata like `usecase=chatbot` or `prompt-version=v2`, etc.
The schema returned by this data source config is used to defined what variables are available in your evals.
`item` and `sample` are both defined when using this data source config.

type.description: The type of data source. Always `stored_completions`.

schema.description:
The json schema for the run data source items.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).

x-oaiMeta.name: The stored completions data source object for evals

EvalStoredCompletionsSource.title: StoredCompletionsRunDataSource
EvalStoredCompletionsSource.description: A StoredCompletionsRunDataSource configuration describing a set of filters

type.description: The type of source. Always `stored_completions`.

model.description: An optional model to filter by (e.g., 'gpt-4o').

created_after.description: An optional Unix timestamp to filter items created after this time.

created_before.description: An optional Unix timestamp to filter items created before this time.

limit.description: An optional maximum number of items to return.

x-oaiMeta.name:
The stored completions data source object used to configure an individual
run

EvalStringCheckGrader.title: StringCheckGrader
EvalStringCheckGrader.description: A StringCheckGrader object that performs a string comparison between input and reference using a specified operation.

type.description: The object type, which is always `string_check`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

reference.description: The reference text. This may include template strings.

operation.description:
The string check operation to perform. One of `eq`, `ne`, `like`,
or `ilike`.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval string check grader object

EvalTextSimilarityGrader.title: TextSimilarityGrader
EvalTextSimilarityGrader.description: A TextSimilarityGrader object which grades text based on similarity metrics.

type.description: The type of grader.

name.description: The name of the grader.

pass_threshold.description:
A float score where a value greater than or equal indicates a
passing grade.

evaluation_metric.description:
The evaluation metric to use. One of `fuzzy_match`, `bleu`, `gleu`,
`meteor`, `rouge_1`, `rouge_2`, `rouge_3`, `rouge_4`, `rouge_5`, or
`rouge_l`.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval text similarity grader object
x-oaiMeta.example:
{
  "type": "text_similarity",
  "name": "example text similarity grader",
  "input": "The graded text",
  "reference": "The reference text",
  "pass_threshold": 0.8,
  "evaluation_metric": "fuzzy_match"
}

type.description: The type of the file path. Always `file_path`.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

FileSearchRanker.description:
The ranker to use for the file search. If not specified will use
the `auto` ranker.

FileSearchRankingOptions.title: File search tool call ranking options
FileSearchRankingOptions.description:
The ranking options for the file search. If not specified, the file search tool will use the `auto` ranker and a score_threshold of 0.

See the [file search tool documentation](/docs/assistants/tools/file-search#customizing-file-search-settings) for more information.

score_threshold.description:
The score threshold for the file search. All values must be a
floating point number between 0 and 1.

FileSearchToolCall.title: File search tool call
FileSearchToolCall.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`, 
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

results.description: The results of the file search tool call.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

weight.description: Controls whether the assistant message is trained against (0 or 1)

FineTuneChatRequestInput.description:
The per-line training example of a fine-tuning input file for chat
models using the supervised method.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

functions.description: A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

x-oaiMeta.name: Training format for chat models using the supervised method

FineTuneCompletionRequestInput.description:
The per-line training example of a fine-tuning input file for
completions models

prompt.description: The input prompt for this training example.

completion.description: The desired completion for this training example.

FineTuneDPOMethod.description: Configuration for the DPO fine-tuning method.

hyperparameters.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job.

beta.description: The beta value for the DPO method. A higher beta value will increase the weight of the penalty between the policy and reference model.

batch_size.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

type.description: The type of method. Is either `supervised` or `dpo`.

FineTunePreferenceRequestInput.description:
The per-line training example of a fine-tuning input file for chat
models using the dpo method.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

preferred_completion.description: The preferred completion message for the output.

non_preferred_completion.description: The non-preferred completion message for the output.

x-oaiMeta.name: Training format for chat models using the preference method

FineTuneSupervisedMethod.description: Configuration for the supervised fine-tuning method.

hyperparameters.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job.

batch_size.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

FineTuningCheckpointPermission.title: FineTuningCheckpointPermission
FineTuningCheckpointPermission.description: The `checkpoint.permission` object represents a permission for a fine-tuned model checkpoint.

id.description:
The permission identifier, which can be referenced in the API
endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the permission was created.

project_id.description: The project identifier that the permission is for.

object.description: The object type, which is always "checkpoint.permission".

x-oaiMeta.name: The fine-tuned model checkpoint permission object

type.description: The type of the integration being enabled for the fine-tuning job

wandb.description:
The settings for your integration with Weights and Biases. This payload specifies the project that
metrics will be sent to. Optionally, you can set an explicit display name for your run, add tags
to your run, and set a default entity (team, username, etc) to be associated with your run.

project.description: The name of the project that the new run will be created under.

name.description: A display name to set for the run. If not set, we will use the Job ID as the name.

entity.description:
The entity to use for the run. This allows you to set the team or username of the WandB user that you would
like associated with the run. If not set, the default entity for the registered WandB API key is used.

tags.description:
A list of tags to be attached to the newly created run. These tags are passed through directly to WandB. Some
default tags are generated by OpenAI: "openai/finetune", "openai/{base-model}", "openai/{ftjob-abcdef}".

FineTuningJob.title: FineTuningJob
FineTuningJob.description: The `fine_tuning.job` object represents a fine-tuning job that has been created through the API.

id.description: The object identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created_at.description:
The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was
created.

error.description:
For fine-tuning jobs that have `failed`, this will contain more
information on the cause of the failure.

param.description:
The parameter that was invalid, usually `training_file` or
`validation_file`. This field will be null if the failure was
not parameter-specific.

fine_tuned_model.description:
The name of the fine-tuned model that is being created. The value
will be null if the fine-tuning job is still running.

finished_at.description:
The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was
finished. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is still
running.

hyperparameters.description:
The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job. This value will
only be returned when running `supervised` jobs.

batch_size.description:
Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters
are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description:
Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid
overfitting.

n_epochs.description:
The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle
through the training dataset.

model.description: The base model that is being fine-tuned.

object.description: The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job".

organization_id.description: The organization that owns the fine-tuning job.

result_files.description:
The compiled results file ID(s) for the fine-tuning job. You can
retrieve the results with the [Files
API](/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

status.description:
The current status of the fine-tuning job, which can be either
`validating_files`, `queued`, `running`, `succeeded`, `failed`, or
`cancelled`.

trained_tokens.description:
The total number of billable tokens processed by this fine-tuning
job. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is still running.

training_file.description:
The file ID used for training. You can retrieve the training data
with the [Files API](/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

validation_file.description:
The file ID used for validation. You can retrieve the validation
results with the [Files
API](/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

integrations.description: A list of integrations to enable for this fine-tuning job.

seed.description: The seed used for the fine-tuning job.

estimated_finish.description:
The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job is
estimated to finish. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job
is not running.

FineTuningJobCheckpoint.title: FineTuningJobCheckpoint
FineTuningJobCheckpoint.description: The `fine_tuning.job.checkpoint` object represents a model checkpoint for a fine-tuning job that is ready to use.

id.description:
The checkpoint identifier, which can be referenced in the API
endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the checkpoint was created.

fine_tuned_model_checkpoint.description: The name of the fine-tuned checkpoint model that is created.

step_number.description: The step number that the checkpoint was created at.

metrics.description: Metrics at the step number during the fine-tuning job.

fine_tuning_job_id.description:
The name of the fine-tuning job that this checkpoint was created
from.

object.description: The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job.checkpoint".
The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job.event".

id.description: The object identifier.

created_at.description:
The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was
created.

level.description: The log level of the event.

type.description: The type of event.

data.description: The data associated with the event.

description.description:
A description of what the function does, used by the model to
choose when and how to call the function.

name.description:
The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or
contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

strict.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the
function call. If set to true, the model will follow the exact
schema defined in the `parameters` field. Only a subset of JSON
Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`. Learn more about
Structured Outputs in the [function calling
guide](docs/guides/function-calling).

FunctionParameters.description:
The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the [guide](/docs/guides/function-calling) for examples, and the [JSON Schema reference](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/) for documentation about the format.

Omitting `parameters` defines a function with an empty parameter list.

FunctionToolCall.title: Function tool call
FunctionToolCall.description:
A tool call to run a function. See the
[function calling guide](/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

type.description: The type of the function tool call. Always `function_call`.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

name.description: The name of the function to run.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

FunctionToolCallOutput.title: Function tool call output
FunctionToolCallOutput.description: The output of a function tool call.

id.description:
The unique ID of the function tool call output. Populated when this item
is returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call output. Always `function_call_output`.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

output.description: A JSON string of the output of the function tool call.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

id.description: The unique ID of the function call tool output.
The unique ID of the function tool call.

Image.description:
Represents the content or the URL of an image generated by the
OpenAI API.

b64_json.description:
The base64-encoded JSON of the generated image. Default value for
`gpt-image-1`, and only present if `response_format` is set to
`b64_json` for `dall-e-2` and `dall-e-3`.

url.description:
When using `dall-e-2` or `dall-e-3`, the URL of the generated image
if `response_format` is set to `url` (default value). Unsupported
for `gpt-image-1`.

revised_prompt.description:
For `dall-e-3` only, the revised prompt that was used to generate
the image.

ImagesResponse.title: Image generation response
ImagesResponse.description: The response from the image generation endpoint.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the image was created.

data.description: The list of generated images.

usage.description: For `gpt-image-1` only, the token usage information for the image generation.

total_tokens.description:
The total number of tokens (images and text) used for the image
generation.

input_tokens.description: The number of tokens (images and text) in the input prompt.

output_tokens.description: The number of image tokens in the output image.

input_tokens_details.description: The input tokens detailed information for the image generation.

text_tokens.description: The number of text tokens in the input prompt.

image_tokens.description: The number of image tokens in the input prompt.

Includable.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently
supported values are:
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of  the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.

InputAudio.title: Audio input
InputAudio.description: An audio input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_audio`.

data.description: Base64-encoded audio data.

format.description:
The format of the audio data. Currently supported formats are `mp3` and
`wav`.

oneOf.title: Item
oneOf.description:
An item representing part of the context for the response to be 
generated by the model. Can contain text, images, and audio inputs,
as well as previous assistant responses and tool call outputs.

InputMessage.title: Input message
InputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always set to `message`.

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `system`, or `developer`.

status.description:
The status of item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

InputMessageContentList.title: Input item content list
InputMessageContentList.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content
types.

id.description: The unique ID of the message input.

Invite.description: Represents an individual `invite` to the organization.

object.description: The object type, which is always `organization.invite`

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints

email.description: The email address of the individual to whom the invite was sent

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

status.description: `accepted`,`expired`, or `pending`

invited_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite was sent.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite expires.

accepted_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite was accepted.

projects.description:
The projects that were granted membership upon acceptance of the
invite.

id.description: Project's public ID

role.description: Project membership role

object.description: The object type, which is always `organization.invite.deleted`
The object type, which is always `list`

has_more.description:
The `has_more` property is used for pagination to indicate there
are additional results.

email.description: Send an email to this address

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

projects.description:
An array of projects to which membership is granted at the same
time the org invite is accepted. If omitted, the user will be
invited to the default project for compatibility with legacy
behavior.

id.description: Project's public ID

role.description: Project membership role

Item.description: Content item used to generate a response.

ItemResource.description: Content item used to generate a response.

KeyPress.title: KeyPress
KeyPress.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is 
always set to `keypress`.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

keys.description:
The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an
array of strings, each representing a key.

token.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

MessageContentImageFileObject.title: Image file
MessageContentImageFileObject.description:
References an image [File](/docs/api-reference/files) in the
content of a message.

type.description: Always `image_file`.

file_id.description:
The [File](/docs/api-reference/files) ID of the image in the
message content. Set `purpose="vision"` when uploading the File
if you need to later display the file content.

detail.description:
Specifies the detail level of the image if specified by the user.
`low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using
`high`.

MessageContentImageUrlObject.title: Image URL
MessageContentImageUrlObject.description: References an image URL in the content of a message.

type.description: The type of the content part.

url.description:
The external URL of the image, must be a supported image types:
jpeg, jpg, png, gif, webp.

detail.description:
Specifies the detail level of the image. `low` uses fewer tokens,
you can opt in to high resolution using `high`. Default value is
`auto`

MessageContentRefusalObject.title: Refusal
MessageContentRefusalObject.description: The refusal content generated by the assistant.

type.description: Always `refusal`.

MessageContentTextAnnotationsFileCitatio.title: File citation
MessageContentTextAnnotationsFileCitatio.description:
A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from
a specific File associated with the assistant or the message. Generated
when the assistant uses the "file_search" tool to search files.

type.description: Always `file_citation`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the specific File the citation is from.

MessageContentTextAnnotationsFilePathObj.title: File path
MessageContentTextAnnotationsFilePathObj.description:
A URL for the file that's generated when the assistant used the
`code_interpreter` tool to generate a file.

type.description: Always `file_path`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the file that was generated.

MessageContentTextObject.title: Text
MessageContentTextObject.description: The text content that is part of a message.

type.description: Always `text`.

value.description: The data that makes up the text.

MessageDeltaContentImageFileObject.title: Image file
MessageDeltaContentImageFileObject.description:
References an image [File](/docs/api-reference/files) in the
content of a message.

index.description: The index of the content part in the message.

type.description: Always `image_file`.

file_id.description:
The [File](/docs/api-reference/files) ID of the image in the
message content. Set `purpose="vision"` when uploading the File
if you need to later display the file content.

detail.description:
Specifies the detail level of the image if specified by the user.
`low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using
`high`.

MessageDeltaContentImageUrlObject.title: Image URL
MessageDeltaContentImageUrlObject.description: References an image URL in the content of a message.

index.description: The index of the content part in the message.

type.description: Always `image_url`.

url.description:
The URL of the image, must be a supported image types: jpeg, jpg,
png, gif, webp.

detail.description:
Specifies the detail level of the image. `low` uses fewer tokens,
you can opt in to high resolution using `high`.

MessageDeltaContentRefusalObject.title: Refusal
MessageDeltaContentRefusalObject.description: The refusal content that is part of a message.

index.description: The index of the refusal part in the message.

type.description: Always `refusal`.

MessageDeltaContentTextAnnotationsFileCi.title: File citation
MessageDeltaContentTextAnnotationsFileCi.description:
A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from

when the assistant uses the "file_search" tool to search files.

MessageDeltaContentTextAnnotationsFilePa.description:

MessageDeltaContentTextObject.description: The text content that is part of a message.

MessageDeltaObject.title: Message delta object
MessageDeltaObject.description: Represents a message delta i.e. any changed fields on a message during streaming.

id.description:
The identifier of the message, which can be referenced in API
endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message.delta`.

delta.description: The delta containing the fields that have changed on the Message.

role.description: The entity that produced the message. One of `user` or `assistant`.

content.description: The content of the message in array of text and/or images.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was created.

thread_id.description:
The [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) ID that this message
belongs to.

status.description:
The status of the message, which can be either `in_progress`,
`incomplete`, or `completed`.

incomplete_details.description:
On an incomplete message, details about why the message is
incomplete.

reason.description: The reason the message is incomplete.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was completed.

incomplete_at.description:
The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was marked as
incomplete.

role.description: The entity that produced the message. One of `user` or `assistant`.

content.description: The content of the message in array of text and/or images.

assistant_id.description:
If applicable, the ID of the
[assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) that authored this
message.

run_id.description:
The ID of the [run](/docs/api-reference/runs) associated with the
creation of this message. Value is `null` when messages are created
manually using the create message or create thread endpoints.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to attach to the message.

tools.description: The tools to add this file to.

attachments.description:
A list of files attached to the message, and the tools they were
added to.

MessageRequestContentTextObject.description: The text content that is part of a message.
